page.title: 15Interview-Mr. O.Davies
page.content: As a boy Owen Davies went to a private school held in the ante room of the church hall in Creigiau. The school was started and run by John Willie Evans in 1927. "In the days before the 1939 war, housewives could do all their shopping from local tradesmen such as the baker, butcher, greengrocer," said Owen. Owen's dad was the local builder, he had his first lorry in 1922 and that was a First World War relic, with solid rubber tyres. The first houses to be built in Creigiau, after the Second World War, were in Railway Terrace and Castle Close. Soon after that private houses were erected on the large field which is now the recreation grounds. The 1960's saw a large estate being built but sadly Tregarth house was demolished.
